Malasile and 
 Wetsakhulya 
 
 Cornelius Wekunya
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 There once lived a man caled Malasile. 
 
 He had a very god friend caled 
 Wetsakhulya. 
 
 
 These friends always shared whatever 
 they had. Sometimes Malasile even 
 
 forgot about his family. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then one day Malasile wondered to
 himself, “If I ever fel sick, would my
 
 friend Wetsakhulya help me?” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Malasile thought of a plot to test the 
 
 depth of their friendship. He bled blod 
 from a cow and put it in a pot with a lid. 
 He put the pot in his rom. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Malasile stayed in his rom for four days
 and four nights. There was a foul smel
 
 of roting blod coming from the rom.
 The bad smel spread through the whole
 house and compound. 
 
 
 Malasile asked his wife, “Tel the family
 
 and my friend Wetsakhulya that I have a
 terible disease and wil die son.”
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When his family and friend were in his 
 compound, Malasile removed the lid 
 
 from the pot of roting blod. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The smel from the rom was sickening.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Son enough Wetsakhulya began to walk 
 away. With his hand on his nose, holding 
 his breath, he cried, “I’m shocked! My 
 
 friend is roting away!” Wetsakhulya left 
 the compound. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But the family forced the dor of
 
 Malasile’s rom open. They wanted to
 know what type of disease was kiling
 Malasile. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The family found Malasile siting on his 
 bed, grining as he sucked his milet 
 ber. He pointed to a huge pot of malwa 
 
 that he had brought for them to enjoy. 
 
 “I apreciate your concern,” said Malasile 
 
 to his family. “I know now who I can rely 
 on.”
